questions.question: A security specialist is asked for advice on a security measure to prevent unauthorized hosts from accessing the home network of employees. Which measure would be most effective?
questions.explanation: A firewall filters traffic and is effective in preventing unauthorized hosts from accessing a network.

questions.question: What are three states of data during which data is vulnerable? (Choose three.)
questions.explanation: Data is vulnerable in three states: data in-transit, data in-process, and stored data.

questions.question: Which two options are window managers for Linux? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Gnome and KDE are popular window managers for Linux.

questions.question: What is the function of the kernel of an operating system?

options.text: The kernel links the hardware drivers with the underlying electronics of a computer.
It provides a user interface that allows users to request a specific task.
It is an application that allows the initial configuration of a Cisco device.
The kernel provisions hardware resources to meet software requirements.

questions.explanation: The kernel provisions resources from the hardware to meet software requirements.

questions.question: A user creates a file with .ps1 extension in Windows. What type of file is it?
questions.explanation: Files with a .ps1 extension contain PowerShell commands and are known as PowerShell scripts.

questions.question: Why would a network administrator choose Linux as an operating system in the Security Operations Center (SOC)?

options.text: More network applications are created for this environment.
It is easier to use than other operating systems.
It is more secure than other server operating systems.
The administrator has more control over the operating system.

questions.explanation: Linux provides more control over the operating system, has a powerful CLI, and allows for better network communication control.

questions.question: Which statement describes the policy-based intrusion detection approach?

options.text: It compares the antimalware definitions to a central repository for the latest updates.
It compares the behaviors of a host to an established baseline to identify potential intrusion.
It compares the signatures of incoming traffic to a known intrusion database.
It compares the operations of a host against well-defined security rules.

questions.explanation: Policy-based intrusion detection compares the operations of a host against well-defined security rules or policies.

questions.question: Which statement describes the term iptables?

options.text: It is a file used by a DHCP server to store current active IP addresses.
It is a DNS daemon in Linux.
It is a DHCP application in Windows.
It is a rule-based firewall application in Linux.

questions.explanation: Iptables is a rule-based firewall application that allows Linux system administrators to configure network access rules.

questions.question: Match the network-based anti-malware solution to the function.

pairs.left: provides filtering of SPAM and potentially malicious emails before they reach the endpoint
provides filtering of websites and blacklisting before they reach the endpoint
permits only authorized and compliant systems to connect to the network
provides endpoint protection from viruses and malware

questions.explanation: Email security appliance filters spam. Web security appliance filters websites. Network admission control manages authorized connections. Advanced malware protection protects endpoints.

questions.question: Match typical Linux log files to the function.

pairs.left: used by RedHat and CentOS computers and tracks authentication-related events
contains generic computer activity logs, and is used to store informational and noncritical system messages
stores information related to hardware devices and their drivers
used by Debian and Ubuntu computers and stores all authentication-related events

questions.explanation: /var/log/secure tracks auth on RedHat. /var/log/messages stores generic logs. /var/log/dmesg stores hardware info. /var/log/auth.log tracks auth on Debian.

questions.question: On a Windows host, which tool can be used to create and maintain blacklists and whitelists?
questions.explanation: In Windows, blacklisting and whitelisting settings can be managed through the Group Policy Editor.

questions.question: Match the Windows command to the description.

pairs.left: renames a file
creates a new directory
changes the current directory
lists files in a directory

questions.explanation: ren renames, mkdir creates directories, cd changes directory, dir lists files.

questions.question: Match the antimalware approach to the description.

pairs.left: recognizes characteristics of known malware files
recognizes general features shared by types of malware
recognizes malware through analysis of suspicious actions

questions.explanation: Signature-based uses known files. Heuristics-based uses general features. Behavior-based analyzes actions.

questions.question: Which statement describes the Cisco Threat Grid Glovebox?

options.text: It is a host-based intrusion detection system (HIDS) solution to fight against malware.
It is a sandbox product for analyzing malware behaviors.

questions.explanation: Cisco ThreatGrid Glovebox is a sandbox product for analyzing malware behaviors.

questions.question: A client device has initiated a secure HTTP request to a web browser. Which well-known port address number is associated with the destination address?
questions.explanation: The well-known port number used by HTTPs (secure HTTP) is port 443.

questions.question: Why is Kali Linux a popular choice in testing the network security of an organization?

options.text: It is an open source Linux security distribution containing many penetration tools.
It can be used to test weaknesses by using only malicious software.
It is a network scanning tool that prioritizes security risks.
It can be used to intercept and log network traffic.

questions.explanation: Kali is an open source Linux security distribution containing many penetration tools commonly used by IT professionals to test network security.

questions.question: What three methods help to ensure system availability? (Choose three.)
questions.explanation: Equipment maintenance, system backups, and up-to-date operating systems all help ensure system availability.

questions.question: Match the Windows system tool with the description.

pairs.left: a hierarchical database of all system and user information
selectively denies traffic on specified interfaces
a CLI environment used to run scripts and automate tasks
maintains system logs

questions.explanation: Registry stores system info. Windows Firewall denies traffic. PowerShell runs scripts. Event Viewer maintains logs.

questions.question: What would be a reason for a computer user to use the Task Manager Performance tab?

options.text: to check the CPU usage of the PC
to view the services that are currently running on the PC
to view the processes that are running and end a process if needed
to increase the performance of the CPU

questions.explanation: The Performance tab is commonly used to check current computer performance. Two key areas that are shown are memory and CPU usage.

questions.question: What is the difference between an HIDS and a firewall?

options.text: A firewall allows and denies traffic based on rules and an HIDS monitors network traffic.
A firewall performs packet filtering and therefore is limited in effectiveness, whereas an HIDS blocks intrusions.
An HIDS works like an IPS, whereas a firewall just monitors traffic.
An HIDS monitors operating systems on host computers and processes file system activity. Firewalls allow or deny traffic between the computer and other systems.
An HIDS blocks intrusions, whereas a firewall filters them.

questions.explanation: In order to monitor local activity an HIDS should be implemented. Network activity monitors are concerned with traffic and not operating system activity.

questions.question: A PC user issues the netstat command without any options. What is displayed as the result of this command?

options.text: a network connection and usage report
a list of all established active TCP connections
a historical list of successful pings that have been sent

questions.explanation: When used by itself (without any options), the netstat command will display all the active TCP connections that are available.

questions.question:
Consider the result of the ls -l command in the Linux output below. What are the file permissions assigned to the sales user for the analyst.txt file?

ls –l analyst.txt
-rwxrw-r-- sales staff 1028 May 28 15:50 analyst.txt
questions.explanation: The file permissions are always displayed in the User, Group and Other order. The first set of characters is for user permission (rwx). The user, sales, who owns the file can read, write and execute the file.

questions.question: Match the Windows system tool with the description. (Not all options are used.)

pairs.left: a CLI environment used to run scripts and automate tasks
selectively denies traffic on specified interfaces
maintains system logs
a hierarchical database of all system and user information

questions.explanation: PowerShell is for scripting/automation. Windows Firewall filters traffic. Event Viewer maintains logs. Registry holds system config.

questions.question: In a defense-in-depth approach, which three options must be identified to effectively defend a network against attacks? (Choose three.)

options.text: total number of devices that attach to the wired and wireless network

questions.explanation: In order to prepare for a security attack, IT security personnel must identify assets that need to be protected, potential threats to the assets, and vulnerabilities in the system or design.

questions.question: Which device is usually the first line of defense in a layered defense-in-depth approach?
questions.explanation: The edge router connects an organization to a service provider and is typically the first line of defense, having a set of rules that specify which traffic is allowed or denied.

questions.question: Which device in a layered defense-in-depth approach denies connections initiated from untrusted networks to internal networks, but allows internal users within an organization to connect to untrusted networks?
questions.explanation: A firewall is typically a second line of defense. It tracks connections initiated within the company going out and denies initiation of connections from external untrusted networks going to internal trusted networks.

questions.question: With the evolution of borderless networks, which vegetable is now used to describe a defense-in-depth approach?
questions.explanation: The artichoke is now used to provide a visual analogy to describe a defense-in-depth security approach because a single petal or leaf can be moved or removed to reveal sensitive information, unlike the older onion analogy.

questions.question: What is the benefit of a defense-in-depth approach?

options.text: The effectiveness of other security measures is not impacted when a security mechanism fails.
Only a single layer of security at the network core is required.
The need for firewalls is eliminated.

questions.explanation: The benefit of the defense-in-depth approach is that network defenses are implemented in layers so that failure of any single security mechanism does not impact other security measures.

questions.question: Which tool can be used to gather information about the different types of traffic that exist in a network?
questions.explanation: A protocol analyzer is a tool that can be used to survey the network to determine the different traffic types and the amount of traffic in a network.

questions.question: What component of a security policy explicitly defines the type of traffic allowed on a network and what users are allowed and not allowed to do?
questions.explanation: Acceptable use policies (AUP) identify network applications and network usage that are allowed within the organization.

questions.question: Which section of a security policy is used to specify that only authorized individuals should have access to enterprise data?
questions.explanation: The identification and authentication policy section specifies authorized persons that can have access to network resources and identity verification procedures.

questions.question: An administrator discovers that a user is accessing a newly established website that may be detrimental to company security. What action should the administrator take first in terms of the security policy?

options.text: Revise the AUP immediately and get all users to sign the updated AUP.
Immediately suspend the network privileges of the user.
Create a firewall rule blocking the respective website.
Ask the user to stop immediately and inform the user that this constitutes grounds for dismissal.

questions.explanation: An AUP would list prohibited websites. Any changes to this must be updated immediately and signed by all users to be enforced effectively.

questions.question: What three goals does a BYOD security policy accomplish? (Choose three.)

options.text: identify and prevent all heuristic virus signatures
identify which employees can bring their own devices
identify all malware signatures and synchronize them across corporate databases
describe the rights to access and activities permitted to security personnel on the device
identify safeguards to put in place if a device is compromised
identify a list of websites that users are not permitted to access

questions.explanation: A comprehensive BYOD policy identifies which employees can bring devices, describes access rights for security personnel, and identifies safeguards for compromised devices.

questions.question: A user has created a new program and wants to distribute it to everyone in the company. The user wants to ensure that when the program is downloaded that the program is not changed while in transit. What can the user do to ensure that the program is not changed when downloaded?

options.text: Create a hash of the program file that can be used to verify the integrity of the file after it is downloaded.
Install the program on individual computers.
Encrypt the program and require a password after it is downloaded.
Distribute the program on a thumb drive.
Turn off antivirus on all the computers.

questions.explanation: Hashing is a method to ensure integrity and ensures that the data is not changed.

questions.question: A user is running a routine audit of the server hardware in the company data center. Several servers are using single drives to host operating systems and multiple types of attached storage solutions for storing data. The user wants to offer a better solution to provide fault tolerance during a drive failure. Which solution is best?
questions.explanation: Fault tolerance is addressing a single point of failure, in this case the hard drives. RAID provides this redundancy.

questions.question: A user was hired by a company to provide a highly available network infrastructure. The user wants to build redundancy into the network in case of a switch failure, but wants to prevent Layer 2 looping. What would the user implement in the network?
questions.explanation: Loops and duplicate frames cause poor performance in a switched network. The Spanning Tree Protocol (STP) provides a loop-free path through the switch network.

questions.question: Why is WPA2 better than WPA?
questions.explanation: Each evolution of wireless security increased security measures. WPA2 mandates the use of AES algorithms, which are stronger than the methods used in WPA.

questions.question: An administrator of a small data center wants a flexible, secure method of remotely connecting to servers. Which protocol would be best to use?
questions.explanation: Because hackers sniffing traffic can read clear text passwords, any connection needs to be encrypted. SSH (Secure Shell) provides encrypted remote connections.

questions.question: Which service will resolve a specific web address into an IP address of the destination web server?
questions.explanation: DNS resolves a website address to the actual IP address of that destination.

questions.question: A company wants to implement biometric access to its data center. The company is concerned with people being able to circumvent the system by being falsely accepted as legitimate users. What type of error is false acceptance?
questions.explanation: There are two types of errors that biometrics can have: false acceptance and false rejection. False acceptance is a Type II error.

questions.question: Mutual authentication can prevent which type of attack?
questions.explanation: Mutual authentication ensures both parties are verified, preventing an intermediary from intercepting communications (man-in-the-middle).

questions.question: Which utility uses the Internet Control Messaging Protocol (ICMP)?
questions.explanation: ICMP is used by network devices to send error messages. Ping is a utility that uses ICMP.

questions.question: Which technology can be used to protect VoIP against eavesdropping?
questions.explanation: Many advanced technologies such as VoIP require advanced countermeasures like encrypted voice messages to prevent eavesdropping.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a DMZ?

options.text: It analyzes traffic for intrusion attempts and sends reports to management stations.
It creates an encrypted and authenticated tunnel for remote hosts to access the internal network.
It provides secure connectivity for clients that connect to the internal network through a wireless LAN.
It allows external hosts to access specific company servers while maintaining the security restrictions for the internal network.

questions.explanation: The DMZ is an area of the network that is accessible to both internal and external users. It is more secure than the external network but not as secure as the internal network.

questions.question: What two steps should be taken before connecting any IoT device to a home or business network? (Choose 2.)

options.text: Update the device firmware with all relevant security patches.
Ensure all IoT devices are isolated to a single broadcast domain.
Reset all IoT device settings to their defaults before connecting to a live network.
Record the administrative credentials on the login plate in case you forget them.

questions.explanation: IoT devices should be evaluated to ensure that they are able to update their firmware with security patches. In addition, default administrator credentials should always be changed.

questions.question: Which three processes are examples of logical access controls? (Choose three.)

options.text: fences to protect the perimeter of a building
swipe cards to allow access to a restricted area
intrusion detection system (IDS) to watch for suspicious network activity

questions.explanation: Logical access controls include smart cards, passwords, biometrics, ACLs, protocols, and firewalls.

questions.question: Match the type of multifactor authentication with the description.

pairs.left: something you know
something you have
something you are

questions.explanation: Multifactor authentication factors: 'something you know' is a password, 'something you have' is a token/key fob, 'something you are' is biometrics like fingerprint.

questions.question: An organization plans to implement security training to educate employees about security policies. What type of access control is the organization trying to implement?
questions.explanation: Administrative access control involves policies, procedures, and training to limit access.

questions.question: When a security audit is performed at a company, the auditor reports that new users have access to network resources beyond their normal job roles. Additionally, users who move to different positions retain their prior permissions. What kind of violation is occurring?
questions.explanation: The principle of least privilege states that users should only have access to information on a need-to-know basis required for their job.

questions.question: Which access control model assigns security privileges based on the position, responsibilities, or job classification of an individual or group within an organization?
questions.explanation: Role-based access control (RBAC) models assign privileges based on position or responsibilities. It is also known as nondiscretionary access control.

questions.question: Which type of access control applies the strictest access control and is commonly used in military or mission critical applications?
questions.explanation: Mandatory Access Control (MAC) is the strictest access control model, typically used in military environments.

questions.question: Which component is a pillar of the zero trust security approach that focuses on the secure access of devices, such as servers, printers, and other endpoints, including devices attached to IoT?
questions.explanation: The workplace pillar focuses on secure access for any and all devices, including IoT, that connect to enterprise networks.

questions.question: A user has been asked to implement IPsec for inbound external connections. The user plans to use SHA-1 as part of the implementation. The user wants to ensure the integrity and authenticity of the connection. What security tool can the user use?
questions.explanation: HMAC (Hash-based Message Authentication Code) provides the additional feature of a secret key to ensure both integrity and authentication.

questions.question: After a security audit for an organization, multiple accounts were found to have privileged access to systems and devices. Which three best practices for securing privileged accounts should be included in the audit report? (Choose three.)

options.text: Only the CIO should have privileged access.
Reduce the number of privileged accounts.
Only managers should have privileged access.
No one should have privileged access.
Enforce the principle of least privilege.

questions.explanation: Best practices include reducing privileged accounts, enforcing least privilege, and securing password storage.

questions.question: What Windows utility should be used to configure password rules and account lockout policies on a system that is not part of a domain?
questions.explanation: The Local Security Policy tool is used to manage security settings on a standalone Windows system.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the network security accounting function?

options.text: to require users to prove who they are
to keep track of the actions of a user
to provide challenge and response questions
to determine which resources a user can access

questions.explanation: Accounting keeps track of the actions of the user (e.g., logging usage).

questions.question: Because of implemented security controls, a user can only access a server with FTP. Which AAA component accomplishes this?
questions.explanation: Authorization determines which resources the user can access and which operations the user is allowed to perform.

questions.question: What is used to scan a BYOD device to verify that it is compliant with company security policies before the device is permitted to access the network?
questions.explanation: Network Admission Control (NAC) evaluates device compliance with security policies prior to permitting network access.

questions.question: Which AAA component can be established using token cards?
questions.explanation: Authentication validates identity and can be established using token cards ('something you have').

questions.question: What is a characteristic of the security artichoke, defense-in-depth approach?

options.text: Threat actors can easily compromise all layers safeguarding the data or systems.
Threat actors can no longer penetrate any layers safeguarding the data or system.
Each layer has to be penetrated before the threat actor can reach the target data or system.
Threat actors no longer have to peel away each layer before reaching the target data or system.

questions.explanation: In the security artichoke, defense-in-depth approach not every layer needs to be penetrated by the threat actor in order to get to the data or systems. Each layer provides a layer of protection while simultaneously providing a path to attack.

questions.question: Which security measure is typically found both inside and outside a data center facility?
questions.explanation: Continuous video surveillance is a security measure found both inside and outside a data center facility.

questions.question: Which security management function is concerned with the inventory and control of hardware and software configurations of systems?
questions.explanation: Configuration management addresses the inventory and control of hardware and software configurations of systems.

questions.question: Match the term to the description.

pairs.left: information or equipment valuable enough to an organization to warrant protection
potential dangers to a protected asset
weaknesses in a system or design

questions.explanation: Assets warrant protection. Threats are potential dangers. Vulnerabilities are weaknesses.

questions.question: Which two options are security best practices that help mitigate BYOD risks? (Choose two.)

options.text: Keep the device OS and software updated.
Decrease the wireless antenna gain level.
Only turn on Wi-Fi when using the wireless network.
Only allow devices that have been approved by the corporate IT team.
Use paint that reflects wireless signals and glass that prevents the signals from going outside the building.

questions.explanation: Mitigating BYOD risks involves keeping the device updated and turning off connectivity features like Wi-Fi when not in use.

questions.question: Which type of business policy establishes the rules of conduct and the responsibilities of employees and employers?
questions.explanation: Company policies establish the rules and conduct and the responsibilities of both employees and the employer.

questions.question: Which network monitoring tool is in the category of network protocol analyzers?
questions.explanation: Wireshark is a network protocol analyzer used to capture network traffic.

questions.question: What device would be used as a second line of defense in a defense-in-depth approach?
questions.explanation: In a defense-in-depth approach, the firewall would be the second line of defense.

questions.question: What is a strength of using a hashing function?

options.text: It can take only a fixed length message.
It has a variable length output.
Two different files can be created that have the same output.
It is not commonly used in security.
It is a one-way function and not reversible.

questions.explanation: A strength of a hashing function is that it is a one-way function and not reversible.

questions.question: A user has created a new program and wants to distribute it to everyone in the company. The user wants to ensure that when the program is downloaded that the program is not changed while in transit. What can the user do to ensure that the program is not changed when downloaded?

options.text: Encrypt the program and require a password after it is downloaded.
Install the program on individual computers.
Distribute the program on a thumb drive.
Turn off antivirus on all the computers.
Create a hash of the program file that can be used to verify the integrity of the file after it is downloaded.

questions.explanation: Hashing is a method to ensure integrity and ensures that the data is not changed.

questions.question: A company is developing an internet store website. Which protocol should be used to transfer credit card information from customers to the company web server?
questions.explanation: HTTPS uses SSL/TLS to encrypt communication between the client and the server, thus providing confidentiality.

questions.question: A large retail company uses EAP-based authentication in conjunction with 802.1X. When the client first initiates communication on the wireless network, which type of authentication method is used by the client to associate with the AP?
questions.explanation: When 802.1X is used in conjunction with EAP, a wireless device first uses Open Authentication to associate with the AP.

questions.question: What is an example of the implementation of physical security?

options.text: encrypting all sensitive data that is stored on the servers
requiring employees to use a card key when entering a secure area
establishing personal firewalls on each computer
ensuring that all operating system and antivirus software is up to date

questions.explanation: Requiring employees to use a card key when entering a secure area is a physical security implementation.

questions.question: What is a purpose of implementing VLANs on a network?

options.text: They allow switches to forward Layer 3 packets without a router.

questions.explanation: VLANs are used on a network to separate user traffic based on factors such as function or application.

questions.question: A user is purchasing a new server for the company data center. The user wants disk striping with parity on three disks. Which RAID level should the user implement?
questions.explanation: RAID 5 provides striping with parity.

questions.question: Why is asset management a critical function of a growing organization against security threats?

options.text: It identifies the ever increasing attack surface to threats.
It prevents theft of older assets that are decommissioned.
It allows for a build of a comprehensive AUP.
It serves to preserve an audit trail of all new purchases.

questions.explanation: Asset management identifies the ever increasing attack surface to threats as an organization grows.

questions.question: An intern has started working in the support group. One duty is to set local policy for passwords on the workstations. What tool would be best to use?
questions.explanation: secpol.msc is the tool used to set local security policies.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the network security authentication function?

options.text: to determine which resources a user can access
to require users to prove who they are
to provide challenge and response questions
to keep track of the actions of a user

questions.explanation: Authentication requires users to prove who they are.

questions.question: Passwords, passphrases, and PINs are examples of which security term?
questions.explanation: Passwords, passphrases, and PINs are authentication methods.

questions.question: What are three examples of administrative access controls? (Choose three.)
questions.explanation: Administrative access controls include policies, procedures, hiring practices, and background checks.

questions.question: What is privilege escalation?

options.text: A security problem occurs when high ranking corporate officials demand rights to systems or files that they should not have.
Vulnerabilities in systems are exploited to grant higher levels of privilege than someone or some process should have.
Everyone is given full rights by default to everything and rights are taken away only when someone abuses privileges.
Someone is given rights because she or he has received a promotion.

questions.explanation: With privilege escalation, vulnerabilities are exploited to grant higher levels of privilege.

questions.question: A network administrator is configuring an AAA server to manage RADIUS authentication. Which two features are included in RADIUS authentication? (Choose two.)

options.text: separate processes for authentication and authorization
single process for authentication and authorization

questions.explanation: RADIUS authentication supports a single process for authentication and authorization, and encrypts only the password (hidden passwords during transmission).

questions.question: Which access control model applies the strictest access control and is often used in military and mission critical applications?
questions.explanation: Military and mission critical applications typically use mandatory access control.

questions.question: Which access control model allows users to control access to data as an owner of that data?
questions.explanation: In the discretionary access control (DAC) model, users can control access to data as owners of the data.

questions.question: In applying an ACL to a router interface, which traffic is designated as outbound?

options.text: traffic that is leaving the router and going toward the destination host
traffic that is going from the destination IP address into the router
traffic for which the router can find no routing table entry
traffic that is coming from the source IP address into the router

questions.explanation: Inbound and outbound are interpreted from the point of view of the router. Traffic that is designated in an outbound ACL will be denied or permitted when going out the interface to the destination.

questions.question: Refer to the exhibit. A network administrator wants to create a standard ACL to prevent network 1 traffic from being transmitted to the Research and Development network. On which router interface and in which direction should the standard ACL be applied?
questions.explanation: Standard ACLs can only specify source addresses, so the standard ACL should be placed as close to the destination as possible. The destination is the Research and Development LAN (R2 Gi0/0 interface).

questions.question: Which operator is used in an ACL statement to match packets of a specific application?
questions.explanation: The operator (eq) toward the end of the ACL lines is used to match a specific port/service (e.g., eq 80).

questions.question: Which two statements describe appropriate general guidelines for configuring and applying ACLs? (Choose two.)

options.text: If an ACL contains no permit statements, all traffic is denied by default.
The most specific ACL statements should be entered first because of the top-down sequential nature of ACLs.
If a single ACL is to be applied to multiple interfaces, it must be configured with a unique number for each interface.
Multiple ACLs per protocol and per direction can be applied to an interface.
Standard ACLs are placed closest to the source, whereas extended ACLs are placed closest to the destination.

questions.explanation: An implicit deny any exists at the end of all ACLs. Specific statements must be placed at the top because processing stops after the first match.

questions.question: Refer to the exhibit. Which statement describes the function of the ACEs?

options.text: These ACEs must be manually added to the end of every IPv6 ACL to allow IPv6 routing to occur.
These ACEs allow for IPv6 neighbor discovery traffic.
These ACEs automatically appear at the end of every IPv6 ACL to allow IPv6 routing to occur.
These are optional ACEs that can be added to the end of an IPv6 ACL to allow ICMP messages that are defined in object groups named nd-na and nd-ns.

questions.explanation: The ICMP protocol is used for neighbor discovery. The permit statements allow neighbor advertisement and neighbor solicitation messages.

questions.question: What wild card mask will match networks 172.16.0.0 through 172.19.0.0?
questions.explanation: The subnets 172.16.0.0 through 172.19.0.0 share the same 14 high level bits. The wildcard mask matching the difference in the third octet (0, 1, 2, 3) is 0.0.3.255.

questions.question: What method is used to apply an IPv6 ACL to a router interface?

options.text: the use of the access-class command
the use of the ipv6 traffic-filter command
the use of the ip access-group command
the use of the ipv6 access-list command

questions.explanation: A network administrator will use the ipv6 traffic-filter command within interface configuration mode to apply an IPv6 ACL.

questions.question: Which ICMP message type should be stopped inbound?
questions.explanation: The echo ICMP packet (ping request) should not be allowed inbound on an interface to prevent reconnaissance. Echo-reply should be allowed.

questions.question: What type of ACL offers greater flexibility and control over network access?
questions.explanation: Extended ACLs offer greater flexibility because they filter on source and destination addresses, protocols, and port numbers.

questions.question: Refer to the exhibit. A network administrator is configuring an IPv6 ACL to allow hosts on the 2001:DB8:CAFÉ:10::/64 network to access remote web servers, except for PC1. However, a user on PC1 can successfully access the web server PC2. Why is this possible?

options.text: The IPv6 ACL Deny_WEB is applied to the wrong interface of router R1.
The IPv6 ACL Deny_WEB is permitting all web traffic before the specific host is blocked.
The IPv6 ACL Deny_WEB is spelled incorrectly when applied to the interface.
The IPv6 ACL Deny_WEB is applied in the incorrect direction on router R1.

questions.explanation: The IPv6 ACL is permitting all traffic before the specific deny statement for the host, due to incorrect sequence of commands.

questions.question: Which scenario would cause an ACL misconfiguration and deny all traffic?

options.text: Apply an ACL that has all deny ACE statements.
Apply a named ACL to a VTY line.
Apply a standard ACL using the ip access-group out command.
Apply a standard ACL in the inbound direction.

questions.explanation: Having all ACEs with deny statements denies all traffic because there is an implicit deny any command at the end of every ACL.

questions.question: What is the quickest way to remove a single ACE from a named ACL?

options.text: Copy the ACL into a text editor, remove the ACE, then copy the ACL back into the router.
Use the no access-list command to remove the entire ACL, then recreate it without the ACE.
Use the no keyword and the sequence number of the ACE to be removed.
Create a new ACL with a different number and apply the new ACL to the router interface.

questions.explanation: Named ACL ACEs can be removed quickly using the 'no' command followed by the sequence number of the specific ACE.

questions.question: Which two keywords can be used in an access control list to replace a wildcard mask or address and wildcard mask pair? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: The 'host' keyword substitutes for 0.0.0.0 wildcard mask (single host), and 'any' substitutes for 255.255.255.255 wildcard mask (any address).

questions.question:
Consider the following access list.

access-list 100 permit ip host 192.168.10.1 any
access-list 100 deny icmp 192.168.10.0 0.0.0.255 any echo
access-list 100 permit ip any any

Which two actions are taken if the access list is placed inbound on a router Gigabit Ethernet port that has the IP address 192.168.10.254 assigned? (Choose two.)

options.text: Only the network device assigned the IP address 192.168.10.1 is allowed to access the router.
Devices on the 192.168.10.0/24 network can sucessfully ping devices on the 192.168.11.0 network.
Devices on the 192.168.10.0/24 network are allowed to reply to any ping requests.
Only Layer 3 connections are allowed to be made from the router to any other network device.
A Telnet or SSH session is allowed from any device on the 192.168.10.0 into the router with this access list assigned.

questions.explanation: The ACL permits all IP traffic from any source (3rd line) except ICMP echo requests (pings) from the 10.0 subnet. Thus, ping replies and Telnet/SSH (which use TCP) are allowed.

questions.question: Which statement is a characteristic of a packet filtering firewall?

options.text: They examine each packet in the context of the state of a connection.
They are susceptible to IP spoofing.
They have a high impact on network performance.

questions.explanation: Packet filtering firewalls have a low impact on network performance. They are stateless, examining each packet individually and they do not filter fragmented packets well.

questions.question: What is one benefit of using a next-generation firewall rather than a stateful firewall?

options.text: integrated use of an intrusion prevention system (IPS)

questions.explanation: Next-generation firewalls provide integrated IPS, granularity control within applications, and proactive protection from Internet threats.

questions.question: What are two characteristics of an application gateway firewall? (Choose two.)

options.text: Analyzes traffic at Layers 3, 4, 5 and 7 of the OSI model.
Uses a simple policy table look-up to filter traffic based on Layer 3 and Layer 4 information.
Uses connection information maintained in a state table and analyzes traffic at OSI Layers 3, 4, and 5.
Performs most filtering and firewall control in software.
Provides an integrated intrusion prevention and detection feature.

questions.explanation: An application gateway firewall is able to filter information at Layers 3, 4, 5, and 7 of the OSI reference model. When using this type of firewall, most firewall control and filtering is done in software.

questions.question: What are two benefits of implementing a firewall in a network? (Choose two.)

options.text: A firewall will inspect network traffic and forward traffic based solely on the Layer 2 Ethernet MAC address.
A firewall will prevent unauthorized traffic from being tunneled or hidden as legitimate traffic through an enterprise network.
A firewall will sanitize protocol flow.
A firewall will reduce security management complexity.
A firewall will provide accessibility of applications and sensitive resources to external untrusted users.

questions.explanation: Firewalls sanitize protocol flow (preventing exploitation of protocol flaws) and reduce security management complexity by off-loading access control to a few devices.

questions.question: Which type of firewall is commonly part of a router firewall and allows or blocks traffic based on Layer 3 or 4 information?
questions.explanation: A packet filtering firewall uses a simple policy table look-up that filters traffic based on specific criteria. These firewalls are usually part of a router firewall.

questions.question: Which three layers of the OSI model include information that is commonly inspected by a stateful firewall? (Choose three.)
questions.explanation: A stateful firewall provides filtering at the network layer (Layer 3), but also analyzes traffic at OSI Layer 4 (Transport) and Layer 5 (Session).

questions.question: Which type of firewall is supported by most routers and is the easiest to implement?
questions.explanation: A packet filtering firewall uses a simple policy table look-up that filters traffic based on specific criteria and is considered the easiest firewall to implement.

questions.question: Which type of firewall generally has a low impact on network performance?
questions.explanation: A stateless firewall uses a simple policy table look-up that filters traffic based on specific criteria and causes minimal impact on network performance.

questions.question: Which two protocols are stateless and do not generate connection information needed to build a state table? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Connectionless protocols, such as ICMP and UDP, are not stateful and do not generate connection information for a state table.

questions.question: Which type of traffic is usually blocked when implementing a demilitarized zone?

options.text: traffic originating from the private network and traveling to the DMZ network
traffic that is returning from the public network and traveling to the DMZ network
traffic that is returning from the DMZ network and traveling to the private network
traffic originating from the DMZ network and traveling to the private network

questions.explanation: A firewall will usually block traffic that is originating from the DMZ network and traveling to the private network.

questions.question: How does a firewall handle traffic that is originating from the DMZ network and traveling to a private network?

options.text: Traffic is allowed when it is originating from the private network, but the response traffic from the DMZ network will be blocked.
Traffic is usually allowed when it is originating from the DMZ network and traveling to a private network.
Traffic is usually blocked when it is originating from the DMZ network and traveling to a private network.
Traffic is usually not filtered using firewall rules when it is originating from the DMZ network and traveling to a private network.

questions.explanation: A firewall will usually block traffic that is originating from the DMZ network and traveling to the private network to protect the internal network.

questions.question: When implementing a ZPF, which statement describes a zone?

options.text: A zone is a group of administrative devices that protect against rogue access point installations.
A zone is a group of one or more interfaces that have similar functions or features.
A zone is a group of hardened computers known as bastion hosts.
A zone is a group of one or more devices that provide backup and disaster recovery mechanisms.

questions.explanation: When implementing a zone-based policy firewall (ZPF), a zone is a group of one or more interfaces that have similar functions or features.

questions.question: Which statement describes a feature of a zone-based policy firewall?

options.text: The router security posture is to allow traffic unless explicitly blocked.
It does not depend on ACLs.
It uses a flat, non-hierarchical data structure making it easier to configure and troubleshoot.
All traffic through a given interface is subject to the same inspection.

questions.explanation: A zone-based policy firewall (ZPF) does not require the use of complex ACLs. By default, traffic traveling between zones is blocked unless specifically permitted.

questions.question: Which statement describes a zone when implementing ZPF on a Cisco router?

options.text: A zone is used to implement traffic filtering for either TCP or UDP.
A zone establishes a security border of a network.
A zone is used to define security policies for a unique interface on the router.
Only one zone can be attached to a single interface.

questions.explanation: Zones establish the security borders of a network. A zone defines a boundary where traffic is subjected to policy restrictions as it crosses to another region of the network.

questions.question: Designing a ZPF requires several steps. Which step involves defining boundaries where traffic is subjected to policy restrictions as it crosses to another region of the network?

options.text: identify subsets within zones and merge traffic requirements

questions.explanation: The first step in designing a ZPF is determining the zones, which involves separating the network into zones that establish security borders.

questions.question: Which statement describes one of the rules that govern interface behavior in the context of implementing a zone-based policy firewall configuration?

options.text: An administrator can assign an interface to multiple security zones.
By default, traffic is allowed to flow among interfaces that are members of the same zone.
By default, traffic is allowed to flow between a zone member interface and any interface that is not a zone member.
An administrator can assign interfaces to zones, regardless of whether the zone has been configured.

questions.explanation: Interfaces that belong to the same zone allow traffic flow between them by default. An interface can belong to only one zone.

questions.question: Which three statements describe zone-based policy firewall rules that govern interface behavior and the traffic moving between zone member interfaces? (Choose three.)

options.text: Traffic is implicitly prevented from flowing by default among interfaces that are members of the same zone.
Pass, inspect, and drop options can only be applied between two zones.
Interfaces can be assigned to a zone before the zone is created.
If traffic is to flow between all interfaces in a router, each interface must be a member of a zone.
An interface can be assigned to multiple security zones.
To permit traffic to and from a zone member interface, a policy allowing or inspecting traffic must be configured between that zone and any other zone.

questions.explanation: If traffic is to flow between all interfaces, each must be in a zone. Policies (pass, inspect, drop) are applied between zones. Traffic flow requires a policy between different zones.

questions.question: In ZPF design, what is described as the self zone?

options.text: the router itself, including all interfaces with assigned IP addresses
a predefined cluster of servers with configured interfaces
a predefined cluster of routers with configured interfaces
the outward facing interface on the edge router

questions.explanation: The self zone is the router itself and includes all the IP addresses assigned to the router interfaces.

questions.question: How does ZPF handle traffic between an interface that is a zone member and another interface that does not belong to any zone?
questions.explanation: If one interface is a zone member and the other is not, the resulting action is to drop the traffic regardless of whether a zone-pair exists.

questions.question: Which statement describes a factor to be considered when configuring a zone-based policy firewall?

options.text: An interface can belong to multiple zones.
A zone must be configured with the zone security global command before it can be used in the zone-member security command.
The router always filters the traffic between interfaces in the same zone.
The classic firewall ip inspect command can coexist with ZPF as long as it is used on interfaces that are in the same security zones.

questions.explanation: A zone must be created (using the zone security global command) before it can be assigned to an interface.

questions.question: Which statement accurately describes Cisco IOS zone-based policy firewall operation?

options.text: A router interface can belong to multiple zones.
Router management interfaces must be manually assigned to the self zone.
The pass action works in only one direction.
Service policies are applied in interface configuration mode.

questions.explanation: The pass action allows traffic only in one direction.

questions.question: When a Cisco IOS zone-based policy firewall is being configured, which two actions can be applied to a traffic class? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: The three actions that can be applied to a traffic class in ZPF are inspect, drop, and pass.

questions.question: In what step of zone-based policy firewall configuration is traffic identified for policy application?
questions.explanation: Traffic is identified for policy application during the configuration of class maps.

questions.question: When configuring a class map for a zone-based policy firewall, how is the match criteria applied when using the match-all parameter?

options.text: Traffic must match all of the criteria solely defined by ACLs.
Traffic must match at least one of the match criteria statements.
Traffic must match all of the match criteria specified in the statement.
Traffic must match the first criteria in the statement.

questions.explanation: The match-all parameter dictates that packets must meet all the match criteria specified to be considered a member of the class.

questions.question: What are the two classes of encryption algorithms? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Encryption algorithms belong to one of two classes: symmetric (same key for sender/receiver) and asymmetric (two keys: public/private).

questions.question: What term is used to describe the phenomenon of more VMs than can be managed effectively?
questions.explanation: VM Sprawl occurs when an organization has more VMs in the cloud than it can effectively control and manage.

questions.question: Which cloud security domain covers the challenges of delivering, measuring, and communicating compliances when organizations migrate from traditional data centers to the cloud?
questions.explanation: Compliance and Audit Management describes challenges of delivering, measuring, and communicating compliance when migrating to the cloud.

questions.question: A company is deploying a product ordering system on a public cloud. The company IT specialist is working on security measures to protect the cloud resources. What are two possible negative impacts that should be considered when deploying a virtual firewall and an IPS appliance? (Choose two.)

options.text: routing issues associated with virtual security appliances

questions.explanation: Virtual security appliances may introduce bottlenecks when accessing resources or lead to processor overloading.

questions.question: What should be deployed to protect traffic confidentiality between a public cloud and a private cloud?
questions.explanation: A site-to-site VPN connection should be used to protect the traffic flow confidentiality between a public cloud and a private cloud.

questions.question: In which type of environment would a developer run software to verify that required security settings are met prior to production deployment?
questions.explanation: The staging environment should closely match the production environment, allowing developers to verify that software runs under required security settings.

questions.question: Which state of data refers to data moving between the CPU and the hard drive of a server?
questions.explanation: Data in transit refers to any data that is being transmitted, including between devices or motherboard components.

questions.question: Which technology is used to verify the integrity of files to ensure they were not modified in transit?
questions.explanation: Verification of file integrity is accomplished by using a checksum. If the checksums match, no change has occurred.

questions.question: Which threat type describes the case when cloud computing resources are set up incorrectly?
questions.explanation: Cloud misconfiguration occurs when cloud computing resources are set up incorrectly, making them vulnerable to attacks.

questions.question: What term is used to refer to readable data in the context of the data encryption process?
questions.explanation: Readable data is called plaintext, while the encrypted version is encrypted text or ciphertext.

questions.question: Which key component of virtualization allows for running multiple independent operating systems on one physical computing system?
questions.explanation: A hypervisor is a software or hardware program that builds a virtualization environment to support multiple independent virtual machines on one physical system.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the DH algorithm?

options.text: to generate a shared secret between two hosts that have not communicated before
to encrypt data traffic after a VPN is established

questions.explanation: DH is an asymmetric mathematical algorithm that allows two computers to generate an identical shared secret, without having communicated before.

questions.question: Which statement is a feature of HMAC?

options.text: HMAC is based on the RSA hash function.
HMAC uses a secret key that is only known to the sender and defeats man-in-the-middle attacks.
HMAC uses protocols such as SSL or TLS to provide session layer confidentiality.
HMAC uses a secret key as input to the hash function, adding authentication to integrity assurance.

questions.explanation: HMACs use an additional secret key as input to the hash function, adding authentication to data integrity assurance.

questions.question: Which requirement of secure communications is ensured by the implementation of MD5 or SHA hash generating algorithms?
questions.explanation: Integrity is ensured by implementing either MD5 or SHA hash generating algorithms. Authentication uses protocols like HMAC, and confidentiality uses encryption.

questions.question: Which two statements correctly describe certificate classes used in the PKI? (Choose two.)

options.text: The lower the class number, the more trusted the certificate.
A class 0 certificate is for testing purposes.
A class 4 certificate is for online business transactions between companies.
A class 0 certificate is more trusted than a class 1 certificate.
A class 5 certificate is for users with a focus on verification of email.

questions.explanation: A digital certificate class is identified by a number. The higher the number, the more trusted the certificate. Class 0 is for testing; Class 4 is for online business transactions.

questions.question: Which statement describes the use of certificate classes in the PKI?

options.text: Email security is provided by the vendor, not by a certificate.
A class 5 certificate is more trustworthy than a class 4 certificate.
The lower the class number, the more trusted the certificate.
A vendor must issue only one class of certificates when acting as a CA.

questions.explanation: The higher the certificate number, the more trustworthy the certificate. Class 5 is for private organizations or governmental security, which is higher than Class 4.

questions.question: What technology allows users to verify the identity of a website and to trust code that is downloaded from the Internet?
questions.explanation: Digital signatures provide assurance of the authenticity and integrity of software codes and verify the identity of websites.

questions.question: What two assurances does digital signing provide about code that is downloaded from the Internet? (Choose two.)

options.text: The code was encrypted with both a private and public key.
The code has not been modified since it left the software publisher.
The code is authentic and is actually sourced by the publisher.

questions.explanation: Digitally signing code assures that the code is authentic (sourced by the publisher) and has not been modified since it left the publisher.

questions.question: What term is used to describe the technology that replaces sensitive information with a nonsensitive version?
questions.explanation: Data masking replaces sensitive information with nonsensitive information that looks and acts like the original.

questions.question: What term is used to describe concealing data in another file such as a graphic, audio, or other text file?
questions.explanation: Steganography conceals data in a file such as a graphic, audio, or other text file to prevent extra attention to the encrypted data.

questions.question: What is a strength of using a hashing function?

options.text: It can take only a fixed length message.
It is a one-way function and not reversible.
It has a variable length output.
Two different files can be created that have the same output.
It is not commonly used in security.

questions.explanation: Hashing functions are one-way functions, meaning they are not reversible. They take arbitrary input length and produce a fixed output.

questions.question: An investigator finds a USB drive at a crime scene and wants to present it as evidence in court. The investigator takes the USB drive and creates a forensic image of it and takes a hash of both the original USB device and the image that was created. What is the investigator attempting to prove about the USB drive when the evidence is submitted in court?

options.text: An exact copy cannot be made of a device.
The investigator found a USB drive and was able to make a copy of it.
The data in the image is an exact copy and nothing has been altered by the process.

questions.explanation: A hash function ensures the integrity of a file or device. If the hashes match, it proves the forensic image is identical to the original evidence.

questions.question: In which way does the use of HTTPS increase the security monitoring challenges within enterprise networks?

options.text: HTTPS traffic does not require authentication.
HTTPS traffic is much faster than HTTP traffic.
HTTPS traffic can carry a much larger data payload than HTTP can carry.

questions.explanation: HTTPS enables end-to-end encrypted network communication, which makes it difficult for network administrators to monitor the content of packets for malicious attacks.

questions.question: Which type of packet is unable to be filtered by an outbound ACL?
questions.explanation: Traffic that originates within a router such as pings from a command prompt, remote access from a router to another device, or routing updates are not affected by outbound access lists. The traffic must flow through the router in order for the router to apply the ACEs.

questions.question: Refer to the exhibit. What is the result of adding the established argument to the end of the ACE?

options.text: 192.168.254.0 /23 traffic is allowed to reach any network.
Any IP traffic is allowed to reach the 192.168.254.0 255.255.254.0 network as long as it is in response to an originated request.
Any traffic is allowed to reach the 192.168.254.0 255.255.254.0 network.
Any TCP traffic is allowed to reach the 192.168.254.0 255.255.254.0 network if it is in response to an originated request.

questions.explanation: The established argument allows TCP return traffic from established connections to be sent on an outgoing interface to a network.

questions.question: Refer to the exhibit. A router has an existing ACL that permits all traffic from the 172.16.0.0 network. The administrator attempts to add a new statement to the ACL that denies packets from host 172.16.0.1 and receives the error message that is shown in the exhibit. What action can the administrator take to block packets from host 172.16.0.1 while still permitting all other traffic from the 172.16.0.0 network?

options.text: Add a deny any any statement to access-list 1.
Manually add the new deny statement with a sequence number of 5.
Manually add the new deny statement with a sequence number of 15.
Create a second access list denying the host and apply it to the same interface.

questions.explanation: Because the new deny statement is a host address that falls within the existing 172.16.0.0 network that is permitted, the router rejects the command and displays an error message. For the new deny statement to take effect, it must be manually configured by the administrator with a sequence number that is less than 10.

questions.question: When an inbound Internet-traffic ACL is being implemented, what should be included to prevent the spoofing of internal networks?

options.text: ACEs to prevent traffic from private address spaces
ACEs to prevent broadcast address traffic

questions.explanation: Common ACEs to assist with antispoofing include blocking packets that have a source address in the 127.0.0.0/8 range, any private address, or any multicast addresses.

questions.question: What single access list statement matches all of the following networks? 192.168.16.0 192.168.17.0 192.168.18.0 192.168.19.0
questions.explanation: The ACL statement access-list 10 permit 192.168.16.0 0.0.3.255 will match all four network prefixes. All four prefixes have the same 22 high order bits. These 22 high order bits are matched by the network prefix and wildcard mask of 192.168.16.0 0.0.3.255.

questions.question: What are two characteristics of a stateful firewall? (Choose two.)

options.text: uses complex ACLs which can be difficult to configure
uses connection information maintained in a state table
analyzes traffic at Layers 3, 4 and 5 of the OSI model

questions.explanation: Stateful firewalls provide stateful packet filtering by using connection information maintained in a state table. It also analyzes traffic at OSI Layers 4 and 5. Stateful firewalls cannot prevent application layer attacks because they do not examine the actual contents of an HTTP connection.

questions.question: Which type of firewall is commonly part of a router firewall and allows or blocks traffic based on Layer 3 and Layer 4 information?
questions.explanation: A stateless firewall uses a simple policy table look-up that filters traffic based on specific criteria. These firewalls are usually part of a router firewall. They permit or deny traffic based on Layer 3 and Layer 4 information.

questions.question: How does a firewall handle traffic when it is originating from the private network and traveling to the DMZ network?

options.text: The traffic is selectively denied based on service requirements.
The traffic is usually permitted with little or no restrictions.
The traffic is selectively permitted and inspected.

questions.explanation: Traffic that is originating from the private network is usually permitted with little or no restriction as it is traveling to the DMZ network.

questions.question: What is one limitation of a stateful firewall?

options.text: not as effective with UDP- or ICMP-based traffic

questions.explanation: Limitations of stateful firewalls include that protocols such as UDP and ICMP are not stateful and do not generate information needed for a state table. Stateful firewalls also lack user authentication.

questions.question: How does a firewall handle traffic when it is originating from the public network and traveling to the DMZ network?

options.text: Traffic that is originating from the public network is usually forwarded without inspection when traveling to the DMZ network.
Traffic that is originating from the public network is usually permitted with little or no restriction when traveling to the DMZ network.
Traffic that is originating from the public network is inspected and selectively permitted when traveling to the DMZ network.
Traffic that is originating from the public network is usually blocked when traveling to the DMZ network.

questions.explanation: When traffic is originating from the public network and traveling to the DMZ network it will be inspected by a firewall and selectively permitted.

questions.question: Which zone-based policy firewall zone is system-defined and applies to traffic destined for the router or originating from the router?
questions.explanation: Zone-based policy firewalls typically have the private (internal or trusted) zone, the public (external or untrusted) zone, and the default self zone, which does not require any interfaces. The self zone is system defined and applies to traffic destined for or originating from the router itself.

questions.question: What are two benefits of using a ZPF rather than a Classic Firewall? (Choose two.)

options.text: The ZPF is not dependent on ACLs.
With ZPF, the router will allow packets unless they are explicitly blocked.
ZPF allows interfaces to be placed into zones for IP inspection.
Multiple inspection actions are used with ZPF.
ZPF policies are easy to read and troubleshoot.

questions.explanation: There are several benefits of a ZPF: It is not dependent on ACLs, and the router security posture is to block unless explicitly allowed. ZPF policies are easy to read and troubleshoot because of the hierarchical structure.

questions.question: When using Cisco IOS zone-based policy firewall, where is the inspection policy applied?
questions.explanation: After configuring the firewall policy, apply the policy to traffic that would flow between a pair of zones. Use the zone-pair security command in global configuration mode.

questions.question: When a Cisco IOS zone-based policy firewall is being configured, which three actions can be applied to a traffic class? (Choose three.)
questions.explanation: The three actions that can be applied are inspect, drop, and pass. Inspect is for stateful inspection, drop is to deny, and pass allows traffic through.

questions.question: What is the first step in configuring a Cisco IOS zone-based policy firewall via the CLI?

options.text: Assign policy maps to zone pairs.

questions.explanation: The steps for configuring a Cisco IOS zone-based policy firewall are as follows: Create zones, Define traffic classes, Define firewall policies, Apply policy maps to zone pairs, Assign router interfaces to zones.

questions.question: In which phase of application development is new software verified to run under the required security settings?
questions.explanation: In the staging phase developers test the application in a staging environment to verify that software runs under the required security settings.

questions.question: Which algorithm is used with symmetric encryption to provide confidentiality?
questions.explanation: Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) is a symmetric encryption algorithm. MD5 is a hashing algorithm while RSA and ECC are asymmetric encryption algorithms.

questions.question: What is the description of VM sprawl?

options.text: When a process breaks out of the VM and interacts with the host operating system.
VMs are spread over too large of a geographic area.
The demand for VMs is greater than the ability to create VMs.
There are more VMs than can be effectively managed.

questions.explanation: VM Sprawl occurs when an organization has more VMs on the network than it can effectively control and manage.

questions.question: Which cloud security domain covers cloud-specific aspects of infrastructure security and foundations for operating securely in the cloud?
questions.explanation: Infrastructure Security describes cloud-specific aspects of infrastructure security and the foundation for operating securely in the cloud.

questions.question: Match the threats to cloud computing to the description.

pairs.left: occurs when the cloud computing resource is set up incorrectly, making it vulnerable to attacks
occurs when the shared security responsibilities between a cloud customer and cloud provider are not implemented correctly
occurs when a cloud customer employee, contractor, or business partner maliciously or unintentionally compromises the cloud service
occurs when the cloud customer does not have full visibility into the cloud service, making the identification of safe or malicious files more difficult
occurs when user accounts or access privileges are not properly secured and are hijacked by threat actors

questions.explanation: Cloud Misconfiguration is incorrect setup. Poor Strategy is failed shared responsibility. Inside Threat is employee compromise. Limited Visibility is lack of full view. Compromised Credentials is hijacked accounts.

questions.question: An IT enterprise is recommending the use of PKI applications to securely exchange information between the employees. In which two cases might an organization use PKI applications to securely exchange information between users? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Common PKI applications include HTTPS Web traffic and controlling access to the network using 802.1x authentication.

questions.question: Which method tries all possible passwords until a match is found?
questions.explanation: Two common methods of cracking hashes are dictionary and brute force. Given time, the brute force method will always crack a password by trying all possibilities.

questions.question: Which measure can a security analyst take to perform effective security monitoring against network traffic encrypted by SSL technology?

options.text: Use a Syslog server to capture network traffic.
Require remote access connections through IPsec VPN.

questions.explanation: Cisco SSL Appliance can decrypt SSL traffic and send it to an intrusion prevention system (IPS) appliance for analysis to identify risks normally hidden by SSL.

questions.question: What technology has a function of using trusted third-party protocols to issue credentials that are accepted as an authoritative identity?
questions.explanation: PKI Certificate Authority is a trusted third-party entity that issues PKI certificates, which are used to provide authenticity, confidentiality, integrity, and nonrepudiation services.

questions.question: A customer purchases an item from an e-commerce site. The e-commerce site must maintain proof that the data exchange took place between the site and the customer. Which feature of digital signatures is required?
questions.explanation: Nonrepudiation of the transaction means the recipient can take the data to a third party, and the third party accepts the digital signature as proof that this data exchange did take place. The signing party cannot repudiate that it has signed the data.

questions.question: Refer to the exhibit. The IPv6 access list LIMITED_ACCESS is applied on the S0/0/0 interface of R1 in the inbound direction. Which IPv6 packets from the ISP will be dropped by the ACL on R1?

options.text: packets that are destined to PC1 on port 80
ICMPv6 packets that are destined to PC1
neighbor advertisements that are received from the ISP router

questions.explanation:
The access list LIMITED_ACCESS will block ICMPv6 packets from the ISP. Both port 80, HTTP traffic, and port 443, HTTPS traffic, are explicitly permitted by the ACL.
The neighbor advertisements from the ISP router are implicitly permitted by the implicit permit icmp any any nd-na statement at the end of all IPv6 ACLs.

questions.question: Refer to the exhibit. An administrator has configured a standard ACL on R1 and applied it to interface serial 0/0/0 in the outbound direction. What happens to traffic leaving interface serial 0/0/0 that does not match the configured ACL statements?

options.text: The source IP address is checked and, if a match is not found, traffic is routed out interface serial 0/0/1.
The resulting action is determined by the destination IP address and port number.
The resulting action is determined by the destination IP address.

questions.explanation: Any traffic that does not match one of the statements in an ACL has the implicit deny applied to it, which means the traffic is dropped.

questions.question: Which two statements describe the two configuration models for Cisco IOS firewalls? (Choose two.)

options.text: The IOS Classic Firewall and ZPF cannot be combined on a single interface.
IOS Classic Firewalls must be enabled in the router configuration before enabling ZPF.
Both IOS Classic Firewall and ZPF models require ACLs to define traffic filtering policies.
ZPF must be enabled in the router configuration before enabling an IOS Classic Firewall.
IOS Classic Firewalls and ZPF models can be enabled on a router concurrently.

questions.explanation:
There are two configuration models for Cisco IOS Firewalls, IOS Classic Firewalls and zone-based policy firewalls (ZPF).
Both configuration models can be enabled concurrently on a router but they cannot be combined on a single interface. One benefit of using ZPF is that ZPF is not dependent on ACLs.

questions.question: What are two properties of a cryptographic hash function? (Choose two.)

options.text: The hash function is one way and irreversible.
Complex inputs will produce complex hashes.
The output is a fixed length.
The input for a particular hash algorithm has to have a fixed size.
Hash functions can be duplicated for authentication purposes.

questions.explanation:
A cryptographic hash function should have the following properties:
1. The input can be any length.
2. The output has a fixed length.
3. The hash value is relatively easy to compute for any given input.
4. The hash is one way and not reversible.
5. The hash is collision free, meaning that two different input values will result in different hash values.

questions.question: Which technique can be used to leverage virtual network topologies to run smaller and more isolated networks without incurring additional hardware costs?
questions.explanation: Microsegmentation (also referred to as hypersegregation) leverages virtual network topologies to run smaller and more isolated networks without incurring additional hardware costs. Microsegmentation techniques allow for more granular control of security for traffic and workflows within the cloud.

questions.question: Match the description with the correct term.

pairs.left: creating a message that says one thing but means something else to a specific audience
making a message confusing so it is harder to understand
discovering that hidden information exists within a graphic file
hiding data within an audio file

questions.explanation:
Social steganography = creating a message that says one thing but means something else to a specific audience
Obfuscation = making a message confusing so it is harder to understand
Steganalysis = discovering that hidden information exists within a graphic file
Steganography = hiding data within an audio file

questions.question: How do cybercriminals make use of a malicious iFrame?

options.text: The attacker redirects traffic to an incorrect DNS server.
The iFrame allows multiple DNS subdomains to be used.
The attacker embeds malicious content in business appropriate files.
The iFrame allows the browser to load a web page from another source.

questions.explanation: An inline frame or iFrame is an HTML element that allows the browser to load a different web page from another source.

questions.question: In which way does the use of HTTPS increase the security monitoring challenges within enterprise networks?

options.text: HTTPS traffic does not require authentication.
HTTPS traffic is much faster than HTTP traffic.
HTTPS traffic can carry a much larger data payload than HTTP can carry.

questions.explanation: HTTPS enables end-to-end encrypted network communication, which adds further challenges for network administrators to monitor the content of packets to catch malicious attacks.

questions.question: Which network service synchronizes the time across all devices on the network?
questions.explanation: The NTP keeps the time across all devices synchronized by using a hierarchical system of sources.

questions.question: Which type of server daemon accepts messages sent by network devices to create a collection of log entries?
questions.explanation: Syslog creates a collection of log entries by accepting messages from network devices.

questions.question: What port number would be used if a threat actor was using NTP to direct DDoS attacks?
questions.explanation: NTP uses UDP port number 123. Threat actors could use port 123 on NTP systems in order to direct DDoS attacks through vulnerabilities in client or server software.

questions.question: Which protocol is used to send e-mail messages between two servers that are in different e-mail domains?
questions.explanation: SMTP is used to send data between mail servers and to send data from a host to a mail server.

questions.question: What type of server can threat actors use DNS to communicate with?
questions.explanation: Some malware uses DNS to communicate with command-and-control (CnC) servers to exfiltrate data in traffic that is disguised as normal DNS query traffic.

questions.question: Which type of server would support the SMTP, POP, and IMAP protocols?
questions.explanation: The Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) is used to send email. The Post Office Protocol (POP) and Internet Message Access Protocol (IMAP) are used to retrieve email.

questions.question: What method allows VPN traffic to remain confidential?
questions.explanation: Plain text data that is transported over the Internet can be intercepted and read. The data should be encrypted to keep it private.

questions.question: To facilitate the troubleshooting process, which inbound ICMP message should be permitted on an outside interface?
questions.explanation: By allowing the ICMP echo reply message inbound to the organization, internal users are allowed to ping external addresses (and the reply message allowed to return).

questions.question: Which statement describes the function provided by the Tor network?
